title: MAFS Ryan Gallagher scores 2DAYFM national radio show
text:
Ryan Gallagher left last year's Married At First Sight without finding love.

But now the fan-favourite has instead landed a national radio show with struggling network 2DayFM.

'Sunday's @hitnetworkaus national show The Sunday Experiment with Ryan and Mandy 8pm - 10pm,' Ryan's caption read.

His newest project! Married At First Sight's Ryan Gallagher lands new job as weekend presenter on 2DayFM... after touring his stand-up comedy act

The 31-year-old Sydneysider took to Instagram to share the exciting news with his 163,000 followers.

The lovable larrikin has been making the most of his newfound fame since leaving the show.

Late last year, the former tradesman ventured into one of his dream careers, stand-up comedy.

Making a name for himself: The lovable larrikin is making the most of his new found fame since leaving Married At First Sight

Ryan did a number of shows around the country with his comedy routine.

He took to the stage showing no mercy to his former reality show co-stars, especially Davina Rankin, the woman he was partnered with for the experiment.

'So, Davina's threatening to sue me. Well, ah, good luck, f---. I was shocked. Not at the fact she's suing me. It's the most attention she's paid me since we were married.

Dream career: He tried stand-up comedy last year where he roasted his 'ex' from the show Davina Rankin, who threatened to sue him over the jokes he made about her

'And good f---ing luck suing me, too. All I got is two French bulldogs and a beard trimmer. She could do with a beard trimmer, though.'

Davina threatened to sue Ryan over text message if he continued to make jokes at the expense after he allegedly referred to her as a 'pig' during a comedy skit.

Ryan was in the middle of one of the most controversial storylines in his series when Davina 'cheated' on him with another one of the contestants, Dean.
description: Ryan Gallagher left last year's Married At First Sight without finding love. But now the fan-favourite has instead landed a national radio show with struggling network 2DayFM.
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
